Reviews.Title: “You wouldn't want to be here in 5 years' time”
Reviews.Author: WordWarrior82
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a 3* hotel. You do only get what you pay for. This is neither the Meridan or the Rotana, both of which are within a stone's throw from the Rose (and if you want a decent pub in which to drink, go across the road to Nelson's in the Rotana) But to business. This place is almost brand spanking new as I write this in March of 2012 and I have stayed there 3 times so far because my company office is across the road. It is in Tecom C which is not, by any stretch of the imagination, finished. So, anywhere you walk, including getting to the Rose on foot or sallying out of a night involves ploughing through acres of sand (and there is no shoe polisher anywhere in the hotel). The staff of the hotel are just downright substandard. For example, booking in, after I received my room key I asked if the room was a smoking room. Three times I received the answer yessir. However, there is not an ashtray to be found in the room and the record for getting a cheap glass ashtray delivered to my room is currently 4 hours. This is partly due to the fact that when i rang housekeeping I had to embark on a chain of 'phone calls, being deferred from one person to the next, each denying that the provision of an ashtray was within their scope of work. Ringing reception didn't help......................they never picked up the 'phone. As far as smoking is concerned, I really don't think they have a policy so non-smokers beware! There is some wierd dining rule in the Rock Bottom cafe involving payimg 100 dirhams for the privelege of gracing their premises and/or getting a rubber stamp on your hand. As far as I can gather, the rule come into force at 8 of an evening although I have yet to get a word of sense out of the Filipino receptionist. The alternative Sports bar is absolutely the place to be if you want to be ignored by a Filipino waitress. I have not yet been brave enough to try the Bollywood and Rocky's bars.The breakfast is just downright unpalatable and definitely does not cater for European tastes. But....................if you know the Ramee group, its origins and its business, all of this should be now surprise. As I said, the place is new so the rooms look good (although don't look under the bed which hasn't seen a vaccum cleaner since the place opened and in my last room, the bedside lamp was already hanging off by its wires). Quite what this place will be like once it has had a few years' wear and tear is anybody's guess but this traveller thinks that its one saving grace will also have disappeared. A place to stay if you want relatively cheap business accomodation, fine. For anything else, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sarosh D
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive about this hotel but in reality, it was a great place to stay. The rooms have all the facilities like a fridge, kettle and they are very clean. That's what you want from the hotel. The staff are nice and from outside the hotel, you can catch a bus to the Internet City Metro Station or its a 10 minute walk. There is a 24hour supermarket just opposite the hotel and it was a nice place to stay and do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for singles”
Reviews.Author: Humeid
Reviews.Content: Service was bad but nice hotel and what a mess at night from as lots the bars they have

Reviews.Title: “Worth Adjusting for the Money you are Paying”
Reviews.Author: Mustafa S
Reviews.Content: Located in Tecon Area of dubai and approx 10 minutes walk from Dubai Internet City Metro,for 225 AED per night for a double room,which includes breakfast for two people,you couldnt realy ask for more. The staff of the hotel is phillipinos and asias(Indians and pakistanis).The reception dint have our rooms ready on arrival.It took them over 30 minutes to get one room ready and then an additional 2 hours to get the teh second room ready. In case you call the reception for any assistance,be prepared to call back again or else wait.A lady by the nam ecathy at the reception,very rude!The hotel has its own pubs,restaurants etc.We only had breakfast at the hotel.As there is a metro near by,you are well connected to dubai. The room that we were provided was spacious.The doors of the cupboard were broken,the dustbin lids were broken.Reast everything was perfect,comfortable bed and clean bathroom.Whiel checking out i did ask cathy for a feedback form...twice,i never received it!Also,the hotel has an option for 150 AED for an airport pick up & drop,do avail of that as if you were to take a one way taxi on your own,you will end up paying minimum 100 AED. Once again,only on the basis of the money that you pay here,its worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: dd78
Reviews.Content: The room itself was very nice, a good size and clean. However, the reception staff were unfriendly, incompetent and seemed like helping was an inconvinience to them. However, the worst thing was the fact that there is a nightclub in the hotel and the booming music went on late and kept me awake. I was on the 5th floor and I think the club was on the mezzanine, so god help anyone who is unfortunate enough to be on the 1st or 2nd floors.

Reviews.Title: “Surrealistic”
Reviews.Author: superclarker
Reviews.Content: Before arriving, I had to speak with.. 3!! different staff on the phone in order to get directions to the hotel. No one spoke English at all, so I had to ask a taxi driver. During the check in, the FD clerk suddenly left to attend another guest for a while. No complains about the room, was clean and good value for money. But here it comes the best part: an annoying piano music was being played on the corridor. After calling 3 times to the reception, I had to go down personally to ask for the music to be off. After check out (extremely rude FD agent, again) an e-mail arrives from Booking.com saying that I have not showed up to the room, so a cancellation fee will apply. Now I am struggling with this issue due the incompetence of the Ramee Rose. Avoid it, please.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: runtothebeach
Reviews.Content: Arrival and Check in was quick > Room was clean and i had no complaints there. But then the nightmare begins. With three clubs inside the hotel i couldn't sleep till 3 for the 2 nights i was there. The irritating thump of the music kept me up all night. Room service was ok but the food was not. Avoid the chicken burger at all costs. Breakfast was very boring and standard with nothing great to write about. Staff very friendly but do expect a tip in return. Also being in the middle of nowhere it didn't help and going out was not an option. Being a budget hotel it was fine in that aspect but that is all. Can be really good with a little bit of upkeep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Calm Stay”
Reviews.Author: EgKoko
Reviews.Content: The room was big, neat, clean and quiet. I liked the hotel overall atmosphere. Poor breakfast. Nice People working there though.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: jdmillington
Reviews.Content: Terrible location in the middle of nowhere, and the food will leave you ill for weeks. Having returned a chicken burger as it was still frozen in the middle, the exact same burger returned with a bite missing having been microwaved. You would probably be better off munching on one of the hundreds of rats that hang around in the various noisy building sites surrounding the hotel. I don't think the hotel has been open long, and maybe it will improve, but why risk it, there are much better hotels in Dubai in much better areas that charge less. If you can get it for under $50 USD a night, it might be worth the risk, and even then, eat out. Otherwise, avoid it like the plague.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramee Rose Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: PO Box 26816, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
